Dayton St., Madison, WI 53706-1685 Phone: (608) 262-3924   FAX: (608) 262-9777 Email: jbasney@cs.wisc.edu EDUCATION University of Wisconsin-Madison , Madison, WI. Pursuing M.S. and Ph.D. in Computer Science . Computer Science and English . RESEARCH EXPERIENCE Research Assistant, Condor Project , University of Wisconsin-Madison. January 1996 to Present. As a member of the Education Solutions Department, assisted in the development of a K-12 educational network system. Summer 1995. Honors Project, A Distributed Implementation of the C-Linda Programming Language , Oberlin College. Implemented C-Linda on a network of 5 Ultrix DECstations, using a distributed programming library developed by Professor David Arnow at Brooklyn College. September 1994 to May 1995. Designed and developed a microcode simulator for the MS-DOS PC with a second student and Professor Carl Singer. Tutor, Computer Science I, Oberlin College. February 1995 to May 1995. Graded programing projects written in Microsoft Visual C++. February 1995 to May 1995. Laboratory Assistant, Computer Science III , Oberlin College. Assisted students with lab work in algorithms and the ML programming language. Wrote BASIC programs and system scripts to maintain database and generate reports. June 1992 to May 1995.
